case_title: REGISTERED FIRM SHEIKHAN INDUSTRIES, QUETTA vs WEST PAKISTAN INDUSTRIAL DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION, KARACHI THROUGH ITS CHAIRMAN
respondent: WEST PAKISTAN INDUSTRIAL DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION, KARACHI THROUGH ITS CHAIRMAN

facts.initial_offer_details: Offer for purchase of majority shares in Harnai Woollen Mills, accompanied by a Call Deposit Receipt of Rs. 100,000.
facts.plaintiff_claim: Payment of Rs. 100,000 was an independent transaction and not subject to conditions of subsequent offers.

jurisdiction.plaintiff_argument: Part of the cause of action arose in Quetta.
jurisdiction.defendant_argument: No part of the cause of action arose in Quetta, and W.P.I.D.C. had no subordinate office in Quetta.
jurisdiction.court_ruling: Quetta Court lacked jurisdiction as no part of the cause of action arose there and W.P.I.D.C. had no subordinate office in Quetta.

interpretation_of_law.explanation_ii: Corporation can only be sued where its principal office is located or where it has a subordinate office and part of the cause of action arises.

key_arguments.plaintiff: Payment was made in Quetta, offer was made in Quetta, and acceptance was received in Quetta.
key_arguments.defendant: Payment was encashed in Karachi, and no part of the contract was formed in Quetta.

court_decision.reasoning: No part of the cause of action arose in Quetta, and W.P.I.D.C. had no subordinate office in Quetta. Explanation II of Section 20, C.P.C., requires both conditions to be met for jurisdiction.
court_decision.outcome: Appeal dismissed with no order as to costs.
